text: Gaynor Hopkins (born 8 June 1951), known as Bonnie Tyler, is a Welsh singer, songwriter. She has had several major hit songs such as "Holding Out for a Hero", "Lost in France," "It's a Heartache" and "Total Eclipse of the Heart" which became major hits in the late 1970s and early 1980s. Tyler represented the United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 2013 in Malm√∂ with the song "Believe in Me". The song finished in 19th place. == Awards and nominations == Tyler was nominated for a Grammy Award three times and a Brit Award three times. She was awarded an MBE in 2022. ==Albums== A list of Tyler's albums: * The World Starts Tonight (1977) * Natural Force (1978) * It's a Heartache (1978) * Diamond Cut (1979) * Goodbye to the Island (1981) * Faster Than The Speed Of Night (1983) * Secret Dreams And Forbidden Fire (1986) * Hide Your Heart (1988) * Notes From America (1988) * Bitterblue (1991) * Angel Heart (1992) * Silhouette In Red (1993) * Free Spirit (1995) * All In One Voice (1998) * Heart And Soul (2002) with the City of Prague Philharmonic Orchestra * Simply Believe (2004) * Wings (2005) * Rocks and Honey (2013) There are also collections of songs from the above albums. ==References== ==Other websites== * Bonnie Tyler official website Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:British rock singers Category:Musicians from Glamorgan Category:Welsh Christians Category:Welsh pop singers Category:Welsh rock musicians Category:Welsh singer-songwriters Category:Progressive rock singers Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants
title: Bonnie Tyler
